info.name: SciScope
info.description:
SciScope is a REST API that delivers science news, user-created bookmarks, and analytics insights. Built for educators and science enthusiasts.

### Features

- ðŸ” User authentication via password or OAuth
    
- ðŸ“° Fetch latest news or search by keyword
    
- ðŸ“Œ Bookmark and group favorite articles
    
- ðŸ“Š Analytics for top users and most-bookmarked content

exec: console.log("âœ… Token saved and backup created");
pm.test("Response includes token and user object", () => {

request.description:
Creates a new user with a unique email and password.  
Returns `201 Created` with the new user object.

Attempts to create a user with an email that already exists.  
Should return `400` or `409 Conflict` depending on validation logic.

exec: pm.test("Returns success message and JWT token", () => {

request.description:
Authenticates a user and returns a valid JWT token if credentials are correct.  
Expects a `200 OK` with a token in the response body.

Authenticates a user and returns a valid JWT token if credentials are correct.  
Expects a `200 OK` with a token in the response body.

Authenticates a user and returns a valid JWT token if credentials are correct.  
Expects a `200 OK` with a token in the response body.

Simulates login using a third-party provider (e.g. Google).  
Accepts `provider` and `oauth_id`, and returns a `200 OK` with a JWT token.

exec: pm.test("Returns 409 for email or username conflict", () => {

request.description:
Attempts to log in with an unknown OAuth ID.  
Should return `401 Unauthorized` or `404 Not Found`.

response.name: OAuth login â€“ invalid oauth_id

exec: console.log("ðŸ” Restored main test user token after temporary login");

request.description:
Logs out the authenticated user.  
Returns a `200 OK` with a logout confirmation message.  
Requires a valid Bearer token.

exec: pm.test("Returns no more than 10 articles per page", () => {
pm.test("Response includes an array of articles", () => {

request.description:
### Retrieve News

Retrieves the latest science news articles.  
Returns an array of articles with ID, title, description, and published date.

response.name: Latest Science News

### Retrieve News

Retrieves the latest science news articles.  
Returns an array of articles with ID, title, description, and published date.

exec: pm.test("Returns search results with pagination and article data", () => {

request.description:
Searches for articles containing the specified keyword in the title or description.  
Example: `?keyword=planet`

response.name: Search by keyword
response.body:
{
    "total_count": 6,
    "total_pages": 1,
    "current_page": 1,
    "articles": [
        {
            "id": 72,
            "title": "Pebbles Form Planets",
            "description": "It starts with static electricity and dust swirling around young stars",

Should return `400 Bad Request`.

exec: pm.test("Returns 404 if article ID does not exist", () => {

request.description:
Attempts to fetch an article with an invalid or non-existent ID.  
Should return `404 Not Found`.

response.name: Search by article ID â€“ not found

request.description: > <p >Returns all bookmarks created by the currently authenticated user.</p>

response.name: All bookmarks for a user
response.body:
{
    "total": 5,
    "bookmarks": [
        {
            "id": 5,
            "userId": 1,
            "articleId": 5,
            "bookmarkedAt": "2025-04-27T02:43:08.645Z",
            "article": {

request.description: > <p >Returns all bookmarks created by the currently authenticated user.</p>

Creates a bookmark for the authenticated user using a given article ID.  
Returns `201 Created`.

Attempts to bookmark an article that has already been bookmarked by the user.  
Should return `400 Bad Request` or `409 Conflict` with an appropriate error message.

Deletes a bookmark for the authenticated user by bookmark ID.  
Returns `204 No Content` on success.
